metadata.synopsis: Karlach's inparty dialogue when she's in your party and you click on herOrder of nodes:1. Generic Blockers (Jaheira/Other avatar/Mindflayer)2. IPRDs (will override anything under it)3. Romance branches.4. Astarion's bite5. InRegion/specific situations branches6. Play pretend7. Default greeting node.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use companion debug to recruit Karlach + click on her

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: Fuck off if you're here to talk about Gale. I already know.
0.context: NodeContext: Wounded/ sadPlayer was partnered with Karlach, but ended up choosing Gale. Karlach found out on her own and is now reacting. This shouldn't be a mega aggro 'fuck off,' more like a 'go away'.

138.speaker: Karlach
138.text: Couldn't tell me to my face, huh? Had to wait 'til I just... just figured it out.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.context: NodeContext: Biting. First debrief with player after meeting Gortash. But a little burnt out too. She's a mix of angry, hurt, and tired here, after facing Gortash for the first time (no combat)

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: Let's just keep moving. I don't want to talk.
12.context: NodeContext: one-liner after confronting the player about their role in Wyll's death. She is bitter and pissed.

479.speaker: Karlach
479.text: Can't say you didn't choose well. Wyll looks absolutely besotted.

369.speaker: Karlach
369.text: I know I had designs on you. But I'm glad you found a little happiness with someone who could actually give it to you. Especially someone like Wyll.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Thanks, Karlach. It means a lot to me that you approve.

116.speaker: Karlach
116.text: Wyll's got me wrapped around his little finger, to be honest. You treat him right, you hear?
116.context: NodeContext: Karlach's torn. She adores Wyll and really liked the player, but they've now chosen each other, so she's putting on a brave face.

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: And if this blessed union should result in long term bliss, Auntie Karlach will be here to take the bairns off your hands whenever you wish.
142.context: NodeContext: Putting a dramatic/ lighthearted spin on the player choosing Wyll over her.

146.speaker: Karlach
146.text: Wyll's a serious man. It's not that far-fetched. Anyway. Don't worry about me. Karlach can survive anything. Even you.
146.context: NodeContext: Cheeky. Player just finished telling her they're going for Wyll instead of Karlach, and she's quickly deealing with her feelings and becoming ok with it.

519.speaker: Player
519.text: I do care for Wyll, but I care about you, too. Why do I have to choose between you?

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: 'Cause I'm starving, soldier. I'm not going to share you. Or... whoever comes after you, I suppose. I doubt Wyll would, either.

326.speaker: Karlach
326.text: He's traditional, and I'm just a ravenous beast who wants all the attention for herself. Ain't sorry about it, either.

377.speaker: Karlach
377.text: But look, I wish you both the best. I promise not to make things too awkward. Only just awkward enough.
377.context: NodeContext: Putting a brave face on her disappointment. Trying to keep things light.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.context: NodeContext: Follow-up dialogue after Dammon fixed Karlach's engine so she can touch again

30.speaker: Karlach
30.context: NodeContext: A little panicked and upset. Jaheira is her idol, and Jaheira just left camp permanently.

387.speaker: Karlach
387.text: Wyll has given up so much for me. If I could get over you, let him have you, I would... but I just can't.
387.context: NodeContext: She's torn. In this case, Wyll and the player also had a spark, but the player chose Karlach. K is conflicted cause she loves Wyll a lot, but can't deny her feeligns for the player.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.context: NodeContext: A warm greeting. Previous conversations have led her to see the player in a good light.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: This place is an illithid stronghold. Let's finish what we came here to do and get out.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: I'm fine. Let's just get in and get out.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: Gods, this place is absolutely beautiful. What a wonder.

556.speaker: Karlach
556.text: If we didn't have a god's bidding to do, I'd suggest a bit of stargazing.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: So here you are. I hear I'm not the only keeping you warm at night.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: So. You and Lae'zel, huh? Smashing. Absolutely wonderful.
92.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic. Karlach found out her partner (the player) chose Lae'zel instead.

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: Oh man. I could do with a whole new night of sleep.

104.speaker: Karlach
104.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.context: NodeContext: After a surprise visit from Mizora in Wyll's storyline. Karlach is pissed but only like a 6/10

121.speaker: Karlach
121.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

123.speaker: Karlach
123.text: Hey, we're still going after those paladins, right? Can't leave Zariel's bruisers roaming the coast.
123.context: NodeContext: IG-not, a Karlach-specific swear meaning 'foolish person'

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Right - don't worry, we'll go after them.

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: Good news. Can't wait to see 'em finished.

607.speaker: Player
607.text: Wouldn't you rather just forget about them?

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: Not really. I'd rather send Zariel a message to leave me the fuck alone.

535.speaker: Player
535.text: We have more important things to worry about. The tadpole in our heads, for instance.

272.speaker: Karlach
272.text: Believe me, it won't take long. Let's go mop 'em up real quick and take it from there. Come on! It'll be fun.

125.speaker: Karlach
125.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

140.speaker: Karlach
140.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach is very hurt by the player choosing to sleep with Mizora, who she hates and who works for her old mistress ZarielNodeContext: acknowledges  the player after having been crying. She's really let down by the player so her hurt is shining through.

144.speaker: Karlach
144.context: InternalNodeContext: Character was bitten by Astarion in gameplay.

145.speaker: Karlach
145.text: Hey - can I try something on you?
145.context: InternalNodeContext: This should be its own camp moment. Can go anywhere in the game that we feel Karlach needs something to do.NodeContext: mischievously

163.speaker: Karlach
163.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

164.speaker: Karlach
164.text: Well, look who's here. Shadowheart's new toy.
164.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic. Karlach found out her partner (the player) chose Shadwoheart instead.

182.speaker: Karlach
182.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a player who is courting her romantically and has her respect/high approval

183.speaker: Karlach
183.text: Infernal metal! Yes! We've got to bring this to Dammon soon as we can.

192.speaker: Karlach
192.text: Ohoho yes, this is it! I'm gonna be a whole Karlach!

185.speaker: Karlach
185.context: NodeContext: A little surprised and worried, but relieved

189.speaker: Karlach
189.context: NodeContext: Excited, she's about to start fangirling

199.speaker: Karlach
199.context: NodeContext: Not quite panicking, but starting to feel very nervous and triggered about being back in the Hells.

201.speaker: Karlach
201.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a player who is courting her romantically but she doesn't like them very much.

203.speaker: Karlach
203.text: Shadowheart took it all right, I hope. Don't like to see our girl too down in the mouth.
203.context: NodeContext: She likes SH, so she means this wiht sincerity

209.speaker: Karlach
209.text: Hey. So. You're here to talk about Wyll, right? You and Wyll, I should say.
209.context: NodeContext: Karlach is wounded and sad, but trying to stay steady. Player was partnered with her, but chose Wyll. She really cares about Wyll so is trying to keep it together.

335.speaker: Karlach
335.text: I knew something was wrong. I just wish you would've told me sooner.
335.context: NodeContext: Karlach is wounded and sad, but trying to stay steady. Player was partnered with her, but chose Wyll. She really cares about Wyll so is trying to keep it together.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Maybe I... I've made a mistake. I should never have doubted what we have, Karlach.

414.speaker: Karlach
414.text: I'm only going to say this once, so listen carefully: The people who care about you aren't playthings. You don't get to toss them aside and then pick them up again when you get bored.
414.context: NodeContext: Hurt, but conviction in her voice.

596.speaker: Karlach
596.text: My heart isn't a toy, got it? Treat it like one and you're going to get burned. Badly.
596.context: NodeContext: Hurt, but conviction in her voice.

482.speaker: Karlach
482.text: I'd ask you to explain yourself, but it's clear you have no idea what you want. I hope you figure it out before anyone else gets hurt.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I didn't want you to find out like that. I'm sorry.

442.speaker: Karlach
442.text: It hurts, you know. It really hurts.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: I thought... I thought this was real. I thought this was special. What happened?
159.context: NodeContext: referring to her relationship to the player. Tryign to figure out why they're breaking up with her.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: It wasn't anything you did. I just can't ignore what my heart is telling me.

394.speaker: Karlach
394.text: But... my heart is telling me I love you. It's about the only good news it's given me.
394.context: NodeContext: Voice cracking, sad, because she was partnered with the player and they went for someone else instead.

339.speaker: Karlach
339.text: Argh! I just don't... I don't understand how this happened. What went wrong.
339.context: NodeContext: Trying not to let her feelings show, but she's on the brink of heartbroken tears.

390.speaker: Karlach
390.text: What do you do when the person you want to run to is the one who broke your heart?
390.context: NodeContext: Trying not to let her feelings show, but she's on the brink of heartbroken tears.

398.speaker: Player
398.text: I'll be honest with you: The spark we had just faded for me.

179.speaker: Karlach
179.text: But... but I still feel it. What about that? I guess... that doesn't count?
179.context: NodeContext: Voice cracking, sad, because she was partnered with the player and they went for someone else instead.

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: Gods, what is this?! What's this feeling? I thought I knew every type of hurt there was. I didn't know anything, did I?
31.context: NodeContext: Trying not to let her feelings show, but she's on the brink of heartbroken tears.

443.speaker: Karlach
443.text: You should go. I'll get through this. But it's going to hurt. And the worst part is - is I need to do it alone.
443.context: NodeContext: Trying not to let her feelings show, but she's on the brink of heartbroken tears.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: You were too much for me, Karlach. Too intense. I thought I could handle it, but I was wrong.

122.speaker: Karlach
122.text: It's not your fault. It's... it's mine. I should've known. I shouldn't have... shouldn't have thought...
122.context: NodeContext: Stunned/ a little dazed. The player just told her that they're breaking up with her because she's too intense and they can't handle it. This rejection cuts to the core of her and she's stunned by the pain of it.

513.speaker: Karlach
513.context: NodeContext: She's tryign to contain huge pain and excuses herself before she cracks.Stunned/ a little dazed. The player just told her that they're breaking up with her because she's too intense and they can't handle it. This rejection cuts to the core of her and she's stunned by the pain of it.

589.speaker: Player
589.text: I had my fun with you. That was enough for me.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: Your fun?! You had your fucking fun?! Gods, have I been wrong about you. I don't know if I've ever been more wrong about anything in my life. And that's saying something.

525.speaker: Karlach
525.text: You'd better step away before I do something I regret.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: I'm telling you now, aren't I?

532.speaker: Karlach
532.text: Don't you think I deserve a little better than that?

597.speaker: Karlach
597.text: Oh, all right, bye then. Arsehole.
597.context: NodeContext: Player walks off in the middle of a confrontation with Karlach. She is hurt and annoyed here.

211.speaker: Karlach
211.context: NodeContext: teasing astarion, but with an edge

214.speaker: Karlach
214.context: NodeContext: IG-not, a Karlach-specific swear meaning 'foolish person'

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: Look at you, soldier. If I didn't know better, I'd say you're falling in love.
221.context: InternalNodeContext: Player did act 1 romance scene with Karlach, but not act 2 yet. Player did act 2 romanec scene with another character.

577.speaker: Karlach
577.text: You and Lae'zel, huh? I can see it. She's made entirely of conviction. Enticing, on this trail of unknowns.

364.speaker: Karlach
364.text: Can't have been easy to win her favour. Hats off to you.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Thanks, Karlach. Lae'zel means a lot to me - and so does your blessing.

553.speaker: Karlach
553.text: Well, you've got it. And my friendship, for as long as you want it.
553.context: NodeContext: Friendly but hurt over being dumped. But still on good terms.

448.speaker: Player
448.text: I care about Lae'zel, but you haven't left my heart. Love doesn't happen one-at-a-time.

372.speaker: Karlach
372.text: Try telling that to Lae'zel. And to be honest, I think I'd want someone's heart for my own, too. I'm hungry, you know? I want... everything.
372.context: NodeContext: TElling the player she doesn't want to pursue romance if they're already involved with Laezel. She's tryign to convey that she wants someone's full attention, their full everything. She feels she deserves it after all ths time.

604.speaker: Karlach
604.text: Meanwhile, I'll say a prayer for every soft part of you. Lae'zel's going to whip you into shape, I'm sure.
604.context: NodeContext: Cheeky, a little sad. Putting a brave face  and lightening the mood after the player choosing LZ over her.

226.speaker: Karlach
226.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a former lover who still has Karlach's respect/approval,

227.speaker: Karlach
227.text: Those mercs had zero discipline. Wouldn't have lasted a blink in the Blood War.

232.speaker: Karlach
232.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a love interest player who also has Karlach's respect/high approval

242.speaker: Karlach
242.context: NodeContext: This scene is after her big dark night of the soul monologue after killing Gortash. She leaves to go to camp and be alone for a bit. When the player returns to camp, she's here, having a moment to herself. She's still raw, but is glad to see the player. If I had my way I'd have her seated for this, but we can't do it budget-wise. Maybe another way to get that sadness/ vulnerability across, like crossed arms, hand to chin, that kind of thing? I'll leave it with ye!

261.speaker: Karlach
261.text: Scat. Can't you see I'm almost busy?
261.context: NodeContext: Firmly. She's being interrupted during her romance scene.

279.speaker: Karlach
279.context: NodeContext: She has negative relation with the player so should be a little unfriendly without being too harsh

281.speaker: Karlach
281.text: Well, well! Scuttlebutt around camp says I'm not the only person you've got all a-flutter.
281.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Karlach, and dumped another character in their inpartyNodeContext: Lighthearted, teasing the player

230.speaker: Karlach
230.text: Hope Astarion wasn't too broken-hearted. Though I'm delighted to learn he's got a heart in the first place.
230.context: NodeContext: Still a little light. She does like AStarion, despite his evilness, so she doesn't mean this to hurt him.

282.speaker: Karlach
282.text: So Gortash's parents sold him to a warlock. Why does that sound so familiar?
282.context: NodeContext: knowingly - it echoes her own story

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: I've got no interest in empathising with the fuck. But maybe what he did to me was some kind of mirror of what happened to him.

471.speaker: Karlach
471.text: When you get fucked up, you fuck up right back.

286.speaker: Karlach
286.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

287.speaker: Karlach
287.text: Hear that? All I need is a second bit of infernal metal, and I'm cured!

217.speaker: Karlach
217.text: This is so exciting. Let's make tracks!

289.speaker: Karlach
289.context: NodeContext: Shocked and scared. The player just sent goblin raiders into the druid's grove.

293.speaker: Karlach
293.text: I want to talk about what happened.
293.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

397.speaker: Karlach
397.text: From what I can tell, Astarion really needs you. And you need him, too.

311.speaker: Karlach
311.text: I know I had designs on you. But I'm glad you found a little happiness with someone who could actually give it to you.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Thank you, Karlach. Your understanding means a lot.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Yeah, yeah, I'm an angel. Giving away my one true love to a bloodthirsty toff.
5.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted put-outedness. She likes Astarion but doesn't mind taking the piss out of him.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. She likes Astarion but doesn't mind taking the piss out of him.

190.speaker: Karlach
190.text: Now get out of my sight. I have some stakes to sharpen.
190.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted put-outedness. She likes Astarion but threatening to kill him for stealing her bf/gf  is also funny to her.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I could be happy with you, too. Do I have to choose just one?

480.speaker: Karlach
480.text: I'm not sharing you with that ruffle-collared leech. Over his dead body.
480.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. She likes Astarion but doesn't mind taking the piss out of him.

291.speaker: Karlach
291.text: As long as he treats you right, I can deal. One wrong move, though, and I'm dumping his pomade in the river.
291.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted. She likes Astarion but doesn't mind taking the piss out of him.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Wait - I wanted you, Karlach. But I thought it wasn't possible to be together.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: Well, it might not be. Not with this tin can in my chest. You deserve someone... someone whole.
16.context: NodeContext: She doesn't really belieev this deep-down, but it is her greatest fear - that she's incomplete, defective, and unloveable.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Oh Hells, I want to be with you, Karlach.

139.speaker: Karlach
139.text: I'm not sure what to say.

119.speaker: Karlach
119.text: What about Lae'zel? You mean to say you'd end things with her... for me?

361.speaker: Player
361.text: I would. I want to be with you, Karlach.

412.speaker: Karlach
412.text: Oh, thank the gods. I thought I was losing you for a second there. Not sure this old hunk of junk I call a heart can take any more damage.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: I'll leave it to you to deal with Lae'zel. She'll be all right. Nothing can bring that woman down. Not even you.
22.context: NodeContext: Softly. She feels for Lae'zel and respects her.

531.speaker: Karlach
531.text: Good luck. To both of you.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I'm sorry - I got confused. I do want to be with Lae'zel.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Jerk me around a little more, why don't you? Gods! Look, would you feck off? I'm getting nauseous with all this back-and-forth.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly frustration. She's annoyed at the player, and heartbroken, and just wants to be alone to deal with her emotions. But she's not truly angry with them.

429.speaker: Karlach
429.text: Look, I'll be fine. I liked you, but I'll survive. It's kind of my thing.
429.context: NodeContext: Friendly frustration. She's annoyed at the player, and heartbroken, and just wants to be alone to deal with her emotions. But she's not truly angry with them.

536.speaker: Karlach
536.text: Now. Begone, waffler! Your new love is awaiting their sloppy seconds.
536.context: NodeContext: Friendly frustration. She's annoyed at the player, and heartbroken, and just wants to be alone to deal with her emotions. But she's not truly angry with them.

467.speaker: Karlach
467.text: I thought you and Gale were... I don't know. Official.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: No. I made a mistake. I want to be with you, Karlach.

518.speaker: Karlach
518.text: Gale will be all right, right? Of course he will. He's Gale. If he can take a hit from Mystra, he can take it from you.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: We are. I'm sorry. I want to be with Gale.

405.speaker: Karlach
405.text: What about Wyll? He deserves... everything. He deserves you.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: I want you, Karlach. I'm sure of it.

200.speaker: Karlach
200.text: But poor Wyll. He's going to be heartbroken. Tsk. I don't know if he'll want me to be there for him, but... but, well, I don't know. This is shit.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: I'm glad you chose me. But I'm sorry it comes at the cost of Wyll's heartbreak. Let him down easy, all right?

435.speaker: Karlach
435.text: I'm not sure Astarion's the kind of guy whose heart you want to play with.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: I want you, Karlach. I'm sure of it.

618.speaker: Karlach
618.text: Go tell that parasite you're finished with him. I'll bring him round a bottle of something cheap and cheerful later.
618.context: NodeContext: Harsh friendship. She likes Astarion but doesn't feel major qualms about stealing his love interest.

313.speaker: Player
313.text: I guess you're right. I'm sorry.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: I thought you and Shadowheart were going the distance. You can't have changed your mind.

488.speaker: Player
488.text: I have. It's you I want, Karlach. Only you.

615.speaker: Karlach
615.text: I'm sorry for Shadowheart; it can't have been easy for her to open up to you. But I know she'll be all right. She's got a lot going for her, that one.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: You're right. I'm sorry. I want Shadowheart.

271.speaker: Karlach
271.text: What about Minthara? Weren't you guys in some kind of horrific power play masquerading as romance?

169.speaker: Player
169.text: For a time. But it wasn't right - you're the only one for me, Karlach.

489.speaker: Karlach
489.text: Tell Minthara right away. She needs to be taken down a peg - badly. In fact, she'll probably get off on it.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: You're right. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have bothered you.

457.speaker: Player
457.text: You are whole. But I think we're better off as friends.

573.speaker: Karlach
573.text: The most hideous words in the Common tongue.
573.context: NodeContext: Dealing with her heartbreak at being broken up with with humor. She is in pain though, but is being brash to cover it up.

346.speaker: Karlach
346.text: But give me a wide berth until then. All right?
346.context: NodeContext: Trying to hold it together and not cry, but you get the sense that as soon as the player leaves, she's gonna let it all out.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.context: NodeContext: Wounded/indignant. Player broke up with him then just strolled off.

301.speaker: Karlach
301.text: If that's it, I need to see the body with my own two eyes. I need to know it's over.

309.speaker: Karlach
309.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

322.speaker: Karlach
322.text: It's finished. It's done. I need to see him up close. I need to know he's dead.

323.speaker: Karlach
323.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

333.speaker: Karlach
333.context: NodeContext: partnered with karlach but her approval rating has sunk a bit.

340.speaker: Karlach
340.text: Sharp eyes, soldier. We're not safe here.

344.speaker: Karlach
344.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

358.speaker: Karlach
358.text: Coast is clear. We ought to get some shut-eye.

365.speaker: Karlach
365.text: Gods. A mind flayer's been getting their tentacles all over our dreams this whole time.

255.speaker: Karlach
255.text: I'm really not sure about putting any trust at all in this... thing. It's already shown itself a liar.

572.speaker: Karlach
572.text: I've got my eyes on 'the Emperor.' And Karlach doesn't blink.

383.speaker: Karlach
383.text: I was just thinking. You know - for a while there I thought there was something between us. I know you felt it too.
383.context: NodeContext: Karlach is sad here, reflecting that nothing happened between her and the player. But she's got a mature view of it and is sincere that she's happy to be friends, if the spark faded.

407.speaker: Karlach
407.text: But it blew out, didn't it? Can't capture lightning in a bottle, I guess. No matter much you want to. No hard feelings, of course. That's life.
407.context: NodeContext: Karlach is sad here, reflecting that nothing happened between her and the player. But she's got a mature view of it and is sincere that she's happy to be friends, if the spark faded.

393.speaker: Karlach
393.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

409.speaker: Karlach
409.context: NodeContext: She's in anguish over losing Wyll to his demonic pact (he was sucked into the Hells after the player killed Mizora). Emotion can be quite intense here.

410.speaker: Karlach
410.text: So. You and Minthara. Wow. Impressive.
410.context: InternalNodeContext: PLAYER has only done act 1 Astarion scene - that means they just slept with himNodeContext: Wounded/ angry. Player was partnered with Karlach, but ended up choosing Minthara. Karlach found out on her own and is now reacting.

424.speaker: Karlach
424.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

434.speaker: Karlach
434.text: So. You and Astarion, huh? Were you gonna say it to my face? Or just wait 'til I figured it out on my own?
434.context: InternalNodeContext: PLAYER has only done act 1 Astarion scene - that means they just slept with himNodeContext: Wounded/ angry. Player was partnered with Karlach, but ended up choosing Astarion. Karlach found out on her own and is now reacting.

445.speaker: Karlach
445.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

453.speaker: Karlach
453.context: NodeContext: Greeting node of her main dialogue - this one will get repeated a bajillion times throughout the game, so neutral-ish delivery is best.

389.speaker: Player
389.text: You're the person Wyll's hunting, aren't you?

432.speaker: Karlach
432.text: The Blade of Frontiers? Yeah, he's been on my tail for ages. Thought he'd seen sense by now, though.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: His mission is to kill you. I'm going to help him.

171.speaker: Karlach
171.text: Wait. No - don't. I'm not what he thinks. I'm not a devil, and I never wanted to serve Zariel.

561.speaker: Player
561.text: Exactly what a devil would say.

504.speaker: Karlach
504.text: Gods dammit. Just when I thought I'd made a friend.
504.context: NodeContext: She's going to fight the player soon.

273.speaker: Karlach
273.text: We could've done good things, you and me. But if you want an enemy, you've got one.

399.speaker: Karlach
399.text: Wyll's been deceived. It isn't his fault - but if you kill me, you'll never find out why.

452.speaker: Player
452.text: You don't have the air of a devil. Not by any means.

332.speaker: Karlach
332.text: Thank you. Nicest thing anyone's ever said to me.

423.speaker: Karlach
423.text: Look, I don't know why Wyll's been sent after me. He's a hero, right? Famously so. Heroes don't go around killing normal people.

543.speaker: Karlach
543.text: Believe it or not, that's all I am. A woman from Baldur's Gate who's been away from home too long.

456.speaker: Karlach
456.text: See that you do. Last thing I want to have to do is fight you - you seem sound. I'm sound too. You'll see.

484.speaker: Player
484.text: Did you really think I wouldn't notice you here, devil?

610.speaker: Karlach
610.text: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.

117.speaker: Karlach
117.text: Look - it's an honour to be chased by a famed hero. I'm no devil, though. Not by a long shot.

305.speaker: Player
305.text: My sources say otherwise. Not a devil? Prove it.

348.speaker: Karlach
348.text: How should I do that exactly? Carve out my soul to serve with a nice side of turnips?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You fight in the Blood War for Zariel. You'll bring the Blood War to the Coast.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Yeah, I stowed away on a mind flayer ship so I could bring the war home. Makes perfect sense.

147.speaker: Karlach
147.text: If you'd just hear me out -

350.speaker: Narrator
350.text: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
350.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Fuck. I'll never get used to that.

152.speaker: Karlach
152.text: Look, whatever else it may be, the tadpole isn't a liar. I never wanted to serve Zariel, and I escaped the first chance I could. So stand down.
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gears herself up for battleNodeContext: Ready for a fight if needed.

446.speaker: Shadowheart
446.text: Let's take things down a notch, shall we? She's no devil, Wyll. You'll have to look elsewhere to find fodder for your blade.

472.speaker: Player
472.text: How can I make peace with the monster I was sent to kill?

113.speaker: Karlach
113.text: You know monsters, right? Better than anyone. Look into my eyes. Can't you see I'm not what you think?

576.speaker: Player
576.text: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.

587.speaker: Karlach
587.text: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: I swear to you, on all I am, I'm not what you think.

235.speaker: Narrator
235.text: *Two souls hang in the balance. Kill Karlach, fulfil your contract - and condemn a possible innocent to the Hells. Or spare her and face the repercussions with Mizora.*

402.speaker: Player
402.text: Dammit. This is an unwelcome complication.

492.speaker: Karlach
492.text: Thank the gods, he sees sense! Look, Blade - Wyll - I know you love bashing evil - we have that in common.

241.speaker: Karlach
241.text: Friends? I've gathered quite the collection.

338.speaker: Karlach
338.text: Well met. Now let's kick some arse while there's still arse to be kicked.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Let's start at allies and work from there.

297.speaker: Karlach
297.text: I can live with that. Besides, I enjoy winning hard cases over.

204.speaker: Karlach
204.text: Touchy, touchy. But hey, I spent a decade in Avernus surrounded by imps and devils. Winning you over will be child's play.

462.speaker: Player
462.text: It will mean my undoing, but... I believe you.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: Save your breath. Let's see if this devil bleeds.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. There's too much at stake.

253.speaker: Karlach
253.text: You know, I could've used a few friends. Pity that won't be any of you.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: No. No second-guessing. The devil dies - now.

363.speaker: Karlach
363.text: Too bad. I thought maybe you could be a friend. I could've done with one of those.

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: Easy, Wyll. She's no devil. There's no fight to be had here.

559.speaker: Astarion
559.text: Now, now, children - let's not lose our heads. Figuratively or literally.
559.context: NodeContext: Wyll and Karlach are ready to fight and kill each other. Astarion speaks up to try and stop them

406.speaker: Lae'zel
406.text: Control yourself, Wyll. I understand bloodthirst. But this is no time to quench it.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: I've hunted you to the Hells and beyond. It ends here, Karlach.

600.speaker: Karlach
600.text: For fuck's sake, you must be half troll to have a skull that thick.

426.speaker: Player
426.text: Karlach, about Gortash. I killed him.

466.speaker: Player
466.text: Karlach, I'm worried about what Dammon said about your engine. We need to get you back to Avernus, or it's going to blow.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: How did you end up with such a contraption in your chest?

299.speaker: Player
299.text: It sounds like all we need to do to fix your engine is find some infernal iron.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: So not only do you have this thing in your chest, but it's burning up?

162.speaker: Player
162.text: You got your second upgrade. How does it feel?

327.speaker: Player
327.text: Looks like Soul Coins are really feeding your engine's fire.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: How do you like the upgrade to your engine?

614.speaker: Player
614.text: What does that infernal engine do to you?

247.speaker: Player
247.text: I want to talk about your infernal engine.

345.speaker: Player
345.text: I took care of those Paladins of Tyr for you.

563.speaker: Player
563.text: That fight at the tollhouse really... heated you up, didn't it?

85.speaker: Player
85.text: We've got some infernal metal. What should we do with it?

312.speaker: Karlach
312.text: YES! We need to go find Dammon. I'm going to get a hug! Soon!

422.speaker: Karlach
422.text: Dammon told us to look out for this stuff, right? Let's go find him!

234.speaker: Karlach
234.text: Dammon'll be able to use this, right? I'm on my way to cooling right down.

292.speaker: Karlach
292.text: Volatile stuff. If we find someone who can work with it, I might be able to make use of it. Keep your eyes peeled for an infernal mechanic.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: So - how did you end up fighting in the Blood War?

135.speaker: Karlach
135.text: Trust me, I'll tell you all about it - after we take care of the goons on my tail.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'd like to hear how you ended up fighting in the Blood War.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I'd like to hear how you ended up fighting in the Blood War.

546.speaker: Player
546.text: I'd like to hear how you ended up fighting in the Blood War.

317.speaker: Player
317.text: Mizora said you 'fit the criteria' for Wyll to hunt. What did she mean?

595.speaker: Player
595.text: I met someone who might be able to help you - a smith who worked in the Hells for a time.

491.speaker: Player
491.text: You mentioned a boss who gave you up to Zariel. Who was it?

421.speaker: Player
421.text: In your expert opinion, what's the best way to kill a devil?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Now that those 'paladins' are out of your way, what's next on your agenda?

150.speaker: Karlach
150.text: First things first, I need to get this engine tuned up. Thing's powerful, but it's been feeling volatile ever since I left the Hells.

102.speaker: Karlach
102.text: Can't be too hard to find an infernal mechanic around here, right?

304.speaker: Player
304.text: This isn't where I thought I'd end up. How about you?

320.speaker: Player
320.text: So, what do you think of your hero Jaheira's house?

469.speaker: Player
469.text: How was it, being in the House of Hope?

591.speaker: Player
591.text: Wyll's patron Mizora wanted you dead. Why?

465.speaker: Player
465.text: You and Mizora seem to know each other. How?

384.speaker: Player
384.text: What do you know about the city of Elturel falling into Avernus?

391.speaker: Player
391.text: About those paladins you want us to confront...

413.speaker: Player
413.text: So you had a friend in Avernus. You never said.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: How are you feeling about the loss of Wyll?

441.speaker: Player
441.text: Tell me more about your relationship with Gortash.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: Tell me again why you want to collect soul coins.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Consider telling her your secret: You're a vampire spawn.
20.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion has the option to tell his companion that he's a vampire spawn.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Consider telling Karlach about your relationship to Shar.

501.speaker: Player
501.text: I want to talk about my affliction...

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I have no memories of where I came from, of who I really am. Is this part of ceremorphosis?

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I am drawn to violence, to blood. Obsessions that could become compulsions.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: I tried to kill you when I was possessed. I'm really worried it's going to happen again.

324.speaker: Player
324.text: The cleric is gone. The shadows have devoured the innocent. Oh, glorious night!

400.speaker: Player
400.text: I've discovered I'm a Bhaalspawn. A child of the god of murder.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Karlach, I'm sorry to say the weaponsmith I told you about is dead.

264.speaker: Karlach
264.text: Well, shit. That's a bit of bad luck. Not my first, not my last.
264.context: NodeContext: Karlach was just told the weaponsmith who could help her is dead (but she hasn't met Dammon herslef yet). She's disappointed but trying to put on a brave face. Not the best at hiding her emotions though.

157.speaker: Karlach
157.text: Thanks for letting me know. On to the next thing, I guess.
157.context: NodeContext: Karlach was just told the weaponsmith who could help her is dead (but she hasn't met Dammon herslef yet). She's disappointed but trying to put on a brave face. Not the best at hiding her emotions though.

473.speaker: Player
473.text: Karlach, I'm sorry to say Dammon is dead.

388.speaker: Karlach
388.context: NodeContext: Was just told Dammon is dead. She's met him before and is distraught at this news. Not angry here, but sad/ shocked.

571.speaker: Karlach
571.text: Dammon survived so much already. This world can be so nasty.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: At least he did what he could for your heart before it was too late.

319.speaker: Karlach
319.text: What are the odds we'd meet someone like him just when we needed him most?

455.speaker: Karlach
455.text: I'll never forget what he did for me. Not ever. Gods dammit, Dammon. Why'd you have to go and die?

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I'm worried about your heart - he was our best shot for a fix.

378.speaker: Karlach
378.text: I'll be fine. Or - I don't know. It doesn't matter. A good man is dead.
378.context: NodeContext: Annoyed the player brought up who will fix her heart now that Dammon's dead, but she's focused on Dammon.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: What about your heart? Without him, who will turn down the heat?

396.speaker: Karlach
396.text: He better be peaceful as all hell. If good people have to die, there better be something really lovely on the other end.

275.speaker: Karlach
275.text: Most of us do. But him more than most of us.

368.speaker: Karlach
368.text: Gods dammit, Dammon. This one stings.

355.speaker: Player
355.text: Death comes for us all, eventually.

352.speaker: Karlach
352.text: Don't I know it. But why's it always gotta be so soon?
352.context: NodeContext: Heavy tone, reminded that death comes for everyone.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I'd like to try cooling you down somehow...

310.speaker: Karlach
310.text: If you have any ideas, I'm all for it. Give me all you've got.
310.context: NodeContext: Double entendre on the end, she's flirting.

493.speaker: Player
493.text: I'd like to try cooling you down somehow...

379.speaker: Player
379.text: What's it been like not to touch anyone for such a long time?

193.speaker: Karlach
193.text: Hmm. Sad. I couldn't let myself feel sad in the Hells - letting my guard down would've been a death sentence.

547.speaker: Karlach
547.text: And letting, say, a cambion near me would've been disastrous. I thought it best to just... keep my distance.

521.speaker: Karlach
521.text: But loneliness that deep gets into the marrow. Now that I'm here - among friends - I can feel it burning out of me. Little by little, step by step.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Karlach, I'd love to be able to touch you properly.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Karlach, I'd love to be able to touch you properly.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: I'd take your hand in mine.

318.speaker: Karlach
318.text: And put it somewhere interesting, I hope.

558.speaker: Player
558.text: I'd start by tracing every curve of your body with my fingertips.

173.speaker: Karlach
173.text: You give me chills, baby. No mean feat at my temperature.

450.speaker: Karlach
450.text: Gods, we better find a way to cool me off soon. I'm not sure how much more of this I can take.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I'd kiss you for as long as you'd let me.

485.speaker: Player
485.text: I'd order you to strip naked and take it from there.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: The Emperor has offered us a special tadpole. We'll become partial mind flayers, but we'll get great powers in turn...

560.speaker: Player
560.text: I'd like to discuss something with you - about us. And Halsin.

505.speaker: Player
505.text: Karlach, I'm sorry, but I've fallen for Shadowheart.

411.speaker: Karlach
411.text: You've fallen for Shadowheart? Since when?

382.speaker: Player
382.text: I didn't plan it. It just happened.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: What does that even mean? You just forgot what we had? Or was it that you never even cared?

530.speaker: Player
530.text: Since the beginning. I was just... confused.

257.speaker: Karlach
257.text: Well I wasn't. Not for a second. But I guess that doesn't mean much, does it.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: All that matters is that I'm with her now.

404.speaker: Player
404.text: We need to talk, Karlach. It's about me and Lae'zel.

515.speaker: Karlach
515.text: You and Lae'zel. Please tell me you're not saying what I think you're saying.
515.context: NodeContext: Copping on that the player is here to break up with her.

608.speaker: Player
608.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. I didn't mean to hurt you, but Lae'zel is the one for me.

307.speaker: Karlach
307.text: Oh, I'm so happy for you both. Can't wait for the wedding.
307.context: NodeContext: Angry and sarcastic, she's very hurt here

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Karlach, we need to talk. It's about me and Wyll.

374.speaker: Karlach
374.text: You and Wyll. I hope you're not saying what I think you're saying.
374.context: NodeContext: Copping on that the player is here to break up with her.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. I didn't mean to hurt you, but Wyll is the one for me.

269.speaker: Karlach
269.text: I love Wyll. You know that. But I love you too. How is this possible?

537.speaker: Player
537.text: Karlach, we need to talk. It's about me and Astarion.

509.speaker: Karlach
509.text: Hang on. Please tell me this isn't what I think it is.
509.context: NodeContext: Copping on that the player is here to break up with her.

392.speaker: Player
392.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. I didn't mean to hurt you, but Astarion is the one for me.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: That leech? Really? You'd rather have him than me?
57.context: NodeContext: She's not usually this harsh on Astarion, but her pain is making her lash out

265.speaker: Player
265.text: Karlach, I'm sorry, but I want to be with Gale.

609.speaker: Karlach
609.text: Whoa. What? You... want to be with Gale...?
609.context: NodeContext: Copping on that the player is here to break up with her.

431.speaker: Player
431.text: It's been a while since we connected like we once did.

248.speaker: Karlach
248.text: Yeah. I had the same thought. So much has happened between then and now... maybe we just got a little caught up in it all.

527.speaker: Karlach
527.text: But I'm not going anywhere. I've got plans for the future, you know. And they involve you.

260.speaker: Karlach
260.context: NodeContext: Kind of sweetly. Player has just said 'about our relationship'

56.speaker: Karlach
56.context: NodeContext: Right after a a nice but chaste kiss while travelling around. Playful rather than very sensual, but very much in love.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Are you happy with how things are between us?

229.speaker: Karlach
229.text: If you're happy, I'm happy. Are you happy?
229.context: NodeContext: Trying to show confidence but her fears around being betrayed are showing around the edge

175.speaker: Karlach
175.text: Could've have said it better myself.

594.speaker: Karlach
594.text: I think so too. I've never met anyone like you. And I doubt I ever will again.

356.speaker: Player
356.text: I'm not sure. I think we might not be a good fit, actually.

367.speaker: Karlach
367.context: NodeContext: Player, partnered with Karlach, says they're not sure about the relationship any more. Karlach is surprised and crestfallen.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Karlach, I think things have gone far enough between us.

357.speaker: Karlach
357.text: You're gonna have to tell one of the others to scram if you want to make room for me.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: You'll need to stay behind in camp for now.

612.speaker: Player
612.text: Never mind - you can stay in the party.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: Ah, fine. I'll be here eating dirt or whatever.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: If you insist. I'll make my way back, but don't be long, all right?

284.speaker: Karlach
284.text: Can't reach camp from here, soldier. You'll have to wait to throw me over. So sorry.

460.speaker: Karlach
460.context: NodeContext: A little attitude. Something the player said to her before displeased her.

461.speaker: Karlach
461.text: I need to think a bit.
461.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

487.speaker: Karlach
487.text: Not now. I need a moment.
487.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

495.speaker: Karlach
495.context: NodeContext: Greeting directed at a former lover who has since sank low in Karlach's estimations.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: It takes a brave person indeed to say 'no' to Lae'zel of Crèche K'liir.

331.speaker: Karlach
331.text: To be honest, I'm kind of shocked you chose me. Of everyone with a great big question mark over their future, mine is the biggest and most questionable.

395.speaker: Player
395.text: Hang the future. I'll take whatever of you I can get.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I admit, I've had my doubts. But all paths led me back to you.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: All of it. All of me. If I can have you back. I've got a place for you here. Cosy. Warm. Safe. And you can stay as long as you want.
64.context: NodeContext: Excited, playful, joyful. Hand over chest for 'here'. She loves the player and is starting to feel secure in that love. She's also probably saying to the player what she wants to hear from someone else as well - and what she wanted to hear 10 years ago. Deep down, she wants that cozy, safe, security.

386.speaker: Player
386.text: I always did like questions better than answers.

419.speaker: Karlach
419.text: In that case, we're a match made in... Faerûn.
419.context: NodeContext: Replacing 'heaven.' bit of a non-joke. She says it with a shrug.

251.speaker: Karlach
251.text: Let's ask questions, then. How long can a moment last? Are we as happy as two people can be?

343.speaker: Karlach
343.text: We can spend the rest of our lives looking for answers - but who cares if we find them?
343.context: NodeContext: Max sweetness, softness - she's looking forward to making a life - however long - with the player.

373.speaker: Player
373.text: My future's no more certain than your own. But when I dare to imagine having one, it's always you I see beside me.

578.speaker: Karlach
578.text: I'm seeing you at a desk. Pile of books up to the ceiling. And me barging in with a brace of rabbits for supper.

603.speaker: Karlach
603.text: You start chopping carrots. I stoke the fire. And every night is the best night we've ever had.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: You were the only suitor worthy of my favour. It was a simple choice.

349.speaker: Karlach
349.text: I don't take that lightly, Lae'zel of Crèche K'liir. Your esteem  - your... your everything - means so much to me. I know it isn't lightly given.
349.context: NodeContext: With respect and love. LZ has just told her she is a worthy romantic partner, which in this case means a hell of a lot. Karlach respects her for who she is, and loves her, too.

444.speaker: Karlach
444.text: I'll keep deserving it. I promise.
444.context: NodeContext: With respect and love. LZ has just told her she is a worthy romantic partner, which in this case means a hell of a lot. Karlach respects her for who she is, and loves her, too.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Our destinies have long been entwined. Together, we'll find our happy ending.

376.speaker: Karlach
376.text: Wyll... sometimes I look at you, and I just don't have words for this feeling. You are everything I ever hoped for. Everything I thought I could never have. Never deserve.
376.context: NodeContext: if Wyll romances Karlach, it will really mean a lot to her. He sacrificed so much for her, and that level of care and tending is something she's longed for for a long time. She's verklempt at being chosen by Wyll.

262.speaker: Karlach
262.text: If life decides my fate is a happy ending with you... it will all have been worth it. Everything.
262.context: NodeContext: if Wyll romances Karlach, it will really mean a lot to her. He sacrificed so much for her, and that level of care and tending is something she's longed for for a long time. She's verklempt at being chosen by Wyll.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: Darling, questionable is my primary criteria in a partner.

416.speaker: Karlach
416.text: Argh, I just love listening to you speak. Even when you're being the wickedest little freak in Faerûn.
416.context: NodeContext: If Astarion romances Karlach, it will be a little harsher, a little more jagged than other romances in their repartee and Karlach's decision to stay with him. They are very different, but Karlach will be drawn to his charisma and the deep heart beneath the wickedness. They have similar histories and a lot in common, but it won't be a sweet, perfect love - it will be complicated.

415.speaker: Karlach
415.text: I want to hear it all, Astarion. Every part of you - even the things you think I might not like. I can handle wicked. I can handle you.
415.context: NodeContext: With love in her voice, albeit a fraught love.

496.speaker: Player
496.text: What can I say? I like a challenge. Plus I think you're best able to handle me, and vice versa.

252.speaker: Karlach
252.text: A fair point. The chilly, dark lady and the fire-hearted hellian. A good combination, right?
252.context: NodeContext: Flirtatious undercurrent. Her relationship with SH will be sweet, slow-burn, and gentle, but with a passionate undercurrent.

127.speaker: Karlach
127.text: I know I can make you melt. And I know you can touch me without getting burned. Oh, the possibilities.
127.context: NodeContext: Flirtatious undercurrent. Her relationship with SH will be sweet, slow-burn, and gentle, but with a passionate undercurrent.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: You never stop fighting against fate. I want to fight mine with you.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: You've taught me so much. So much about how much a person can hold. When I look at you, it's like I'm staring at a puzzle I'll never solve. But one I want to spend my life enjoying.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: I'll be strong for you. And you can just be you for me.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Together, we shall untether our fury, and unleash it upon this hapless world!

451.speaker: Karlach
451.text: Yeah. We'll... work on that. Together.
451.context: NodeContext: Laughing, affectionate, almost to herself. The Dark Urge, her love interest, is being kind of a murderous weirdo but harmlessly so.

143.speaker: Karlach
143.text: I'm willing to spend the rest of my life figuring you out.

507.speaker: Karlach
507.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

522.speaker: Karlach
522.text: That was Gortash - the 'gauntlet of Bane'. The man who sold me to Zariel. I'm fucking speechless.

588.speaker: Karlach
588.text: Come on. I need to stomp something, and Ketheric's standing right there.

523.speaker: Karlach
523.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

494.speaker: Karlach
494.text: You and Shadowheart. She's got a sweetness to her, just beneath the surface. And you're good at getting just beneath the surface.

464.speaker: Karlach
464.text: I won't lie: I wish it could be you and me. But... I get that it can't. I do.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: You really are special. Thank you for understanding.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: Of course. What else are friends for?
52.context: NodeContext: Wistful. She wants more from the player, but they're more or less breaking up with her now. But she's keeping her chin up. She understands. No bad blood. She gets it.

528.speaker: Player
528.text: Why do I have to choose between you? I care about you both.

554.speaker: Karlach
554.text: And I'm sure we both care about you. I can't speak for Shadowheart, but for me... I want all of you. Or... whoever comes next.
554.context: NodeContext: A little sad. She doesn't want anyone but the player, but she's putting on a brave face.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: I'm a hungry lady. I don't think I have it in me to share. Not now, anyway.
58.context: NodeContext: A little sad. She doesn't want anyone but the player, but she's putting on a brave face.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: But hey - don't worry about me. If you prefer little miss, then it probably wouldn't have worked out between us anyway. Soldier.
27.context: NodeContext: She's being a little cheeky here, a little serious. Teasing them, but also, she means it. Retaining her dignity after being dumped, but still planning to stay on good terms with the player and holds them no ill will.

542.speaker: Karlach
542.context: NodeContext: IG-not, a Karlach-specific swear meaning 'foolish person'

550.speaker: Karlach
550.text: It's finished. It's done. I need to see him up close. I need to know he's out of commission.

555.speaker: Karlach
555.context: NodeContext: Wyll died during the confrontation; Karlach is sad it came to that.

565.speaker: Karlach
565.text: Infernal metal! Yes! We've got to bring this to Dammon soon as we can.

308.speaker: Karlach
308.text: Let's hop to it. I can't wait to have this done!

567.speaker: Karlach
567.text: That was Minsc. The Minsc. Part of the crew who saved the city from Sarevok all those years ago.

109.speaker: Karlach
109.text: Don't know who 'the Stone Lord' is or what the hell he's gotten himself into. But that man is a legend.

437.speaker: Karlach
437.text: I should've known Gale would weave his spell on you. Who could resist?
437.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet. Player is dumping her for Gale. She's sad but still on good terms and trying to keep things light.

194.speaker: Karlach
194.text: I know I had... well. You know I liked you. Like you. But I want you to be with someone who can make you happy. If that's Gale, that's Gale.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Thank you, Karlach. Your friendship means a lot to me.

511.speaker: Karlach
511.context: NodeContext: Heavy on the subtext. She's putting a lighthearted/ sarcastic spin on the fact that the player just friendzoned her for gale.

590.speaker: Karlach
590.text: Look, I'll be all right. Give me a night to lick my wounds and patch up my pride, and I'll be right back to crushing evil before sunrise.
590.context: NodeContext: Heavy on the subtext. She's putting a lighthearted/ sarcastic spin on the fact that the player just friendzoned her for gale.

196.speaker: Karlach
196.text: Hope you don't regret throwing over all this fire for all that hot air. One'll get you through winter, the other'll recite you a lot of codices. But hey. To each their own.
196.context: NodeContext: Heavy on the subtext. She's putting a lighthearted/ sarcastic spin on the fact that the player just friendzoned her for gale.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: It could be you, too. Why do I have to choose just one?

288.speaker: Karlach
288.text: Oh-ho no you don't. Karlach is a one-person gal. You've made your choice, now you have to live with the consequences.
288.context: NodeContext: Still keeping it a bit light/ teasing.

208.speaker: Karlach
208.text: When Gale's on page one hundred thirty six of a supremely boring recitation, and you look over and there I am throwing a lasso around a giant centipede and riding it to Chult, I'll have my comeuppance.
208.context: NodeContext: Still keeping it a bit light/ teasing.

575.speaker: Karlach
575.text: I don't want to wait any more. Can we knock the others out so we can go to bed?

263.speaker: Karlach
263.text: Gale climbed out of the Weave long enough to waggle his eyebrow in your direction, huh?
263.context: NodeContext: Still a little light. She does like Gale, despite his high-falutin-ness, so she doesn't mean this to hurt him.

585.speaker: Karlach
585.context: NodeContext: Angry but a little burnt out, too. The ashes between the burnings. This is re: Gortash

592.speaker: Karlach
592.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

593.speaker: Karlach
593.text: Careful, soldier. I'm burning really hot.
593.context: NodeContext: Sweating, a little out of breath.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Had a nice break in the Hells. Now that we're back, my engine's in overdrive again.
59.context: NodeContext: Sweating, a little out of breath.

315.speaker: Karlach
315.text: Let's move. A trot will take my mind off being barbecued alive.

606.speaker: Karlach
606.context: NodeContext: Karlach is very awkward interacting with Jaheira because she idolizes her so much. She's also from the Outer City (rougher area) and usually is proud of her roots, but her idolization of Jaheira brings out a smidge of her class anxiety.

613.speaker: Karlach
613.context: InternalNodeContext: Companion confronts Avatar Astarion, telling him they know he's a vampire. Triggers if you make it to Act 2 without him telling you himself or revealing it via camp night bite scene/using bite attack in front of you.

619.speaker: Karlach
619.text: Hope that wasn't a lie; I hope we do get to meet up with Fytz, when this is all over.

569.speaker: Karlach
569.text: First step, save the city. Then, save myself. And last but not least: dinner with an old friend. What more could you ask for?
